g.text: Matsui et al. Magnesium-Based Intermetallic Anode Active Materials
magnesium metal thin ﬁlms were immersed in the BuMeG3
solution for 24 h, right after the sputtering process. Subsequently
the thin ﬁlms were rinsed with monoglyme(G1) to remove the
BuMeG3 solutions. The emission current and the acceleration
voltatge of the X-ray gun is 20 mA and 10 kV respectively.
Argon ion etching, with 20 mA of emission current and 2 kV of
acceleration voltage, was carried out to take the depth proﬁle.
shows XRD patterns and Rietveld reﬁnement results
are assigned to A-type rare earth structure with trigonal
space group. The reﬁnement yields the trigonal lattice with
or antimony occupies another half of 2
results are in good agreement with reported data (
. The crystal structure of both the
can be described as a layered structure
of hexagonal close-packed (h.c.p) bismuth array with Mg atoms
located at the octahedral voids in every two bismuth c.p. layers,
and the tetrahedral voids in the another two bismuth c.p. layers.
Even though the crystal structures of the Mg
are very similar except the slight diﬀerence
of the lattice constants, the electrochemical properties
of these two compounds are signiﬁcantly diﬀerent. The
solution, overlapped with a cyclic voltammogram of the
deposition/dissolution process of magnesium metal in 0.5 mol
(B) Fractional Atomic Coordinates, Occupancies, and Isotropic
in BuMeG3 solution, are shown in
shows very sharp reversible peaks corresponding to
Even though the sweep rate of the cyclic voltammogramis faster
than reported data, the overpotential between the anodic and
cathodic reaction is almost same as previous one:
It suggests that the overpotential is not corresponding to
the reaction kinetics, but thermodynamic properties, such as
solvation/desolvation energy or phase transition of the solid
phase. In addition, the overpotential of the Mg
than that of the deposition/dissolution process of the magnesium
in the BuMeG3 solution. Hence the Mg
some advantages as a practical battery anode in the aspect of
energy eﬃciency, besides its less capacity and higher equilibrium
potential compared with magnesiummetal anode. The expanded

electrochemically active in the composite electrode.
